ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend CHNS 132 to a listening-proficient Chinese-American who would like to improve his/her Chinese. Previous reading, writing, and speaking experience would be beneficial, but are unnecessary. CHNS 132 is a fast-paced but manageable course with a stellar professor; Liu laoshi is extremely gracious, and generous with sharing her own experiences and listening to ours during class conversations and oral presentations. Text& reading and grammar& structure are reviewed separately for each lesson(/story in the book). There are exams every three weeks, a daily quiz on the words and text from the night before, homework every day, a short essay and accompanying oral presentation approximately every week, and a final exam.
I would definitely recommend this class. It's not difficult to do well if you try, and it's a good way to get your basic reading and writing started.

If you're taking Chinese 132, you were probably placed in it and you should definitely take it. It is a bit time consuming, but none of the work is really too difficult. Everything is straightforward and you'll get a good grade if you put in the time.

Chinese 132 was sooooo much fun! It's really not that much work (hw and memorizing characters would be ~ 1 hr outside of class, not bad!) and class itself is fun and engaging. I can tell my chinese has improved already and it's only been a semester!
Yes, 132 is a great class if you are a native speaker and want to learn Chinese.
I would definitely recommend this class to other students who were in the same position as me: unable to write chinese well, but speaking it semi-regularly at home.
